THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONSTRUCTIONS AS ILLUSTRATED ΒΥ PLAUTUS.

A MAN‘S mind is full of ideas or combinations of ideas; these he sometimes wishes to impart to others. To do this he has at his command as means of communication (α) gesture, (β) depiction, (γ) language.

Language then is one of the ways of expressing thought. Certain ideas or relations of ideas arise in A ’s mind which he wishes to express to B3 these ideas are as it were labelled, i.e. they are words, and we may define a sentence (or breath-group) as ‘the linguistic expression of a combination of ideas.' Sentences shade off into many variefies, eg. command, wish, question etc. A combination of ideas may be expressed by (ι) mere juxtaposition of its component parts, (2) gradation according
